docs.lead_paragraph: So Paul Ryan gave his big speech defending his plan — and demonstrated, in case you were wondering, that there’s no there there (and there never was).
docs.abstract: Paul Ryan, same as he ever was.
docs.snippet: Paul Ryan, same as he ever was.

docs.lead_paragraph: The departure of Mike Huckabee from the 2012 presidential campaign probably means that the subject of frying squirrel meat in a popcorn popper will not come up this year.

headline.main: Trump and Huckabee Leave Boring Race Behind

docs.abstract: With Donald Trump out, and as signs point to an election-year pass for TV celebrity Sarah Palin, the 2012 campaign may soon be declared officially — boring.
docs.snippet: With Donald Trump out, and as signs point to an election-year pass for TV celebrity Sarah Palin, the 2012 campaign may soon be declared officially — boring.

docs.lead_paragraph: This is the first in what we expect will be an occasional series on how business owners are succeeding and struggling with their technology needs.

headline.main: The Tech Audit: How a Small Retailer Handles I.T.

docs.abstract: Which strategies are working and which are causing pain.
docs.snippet: Which strategies are working and which are causing pain.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House says it will not submit trade pacts with three nations for Congressional approval until Republicans agreed to aid for workers losing jobs in the deals.

headline.seo: Administration Ties Trade Deals to Job Assistance

docs.snippet: The White House says it will not submit trade pacts with three nations for Congressional approval until Republicans agreed to aid for workers losing jobs in the deals.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Treasury secretary, Timothy F. Geithner, officially informed Congress that the government had reached its $14.3 trillion debt limit Monday.

headline.seo: Government Hits Debt Limit, and Parties Debate Solution
headline.main: As the Federal Government Hits Its Debt Limit, Lawmakers Spar Over Solution
headline.print_headline: As Federal Government Hits Its Debt Limit, Lawmakers Spar Over Solution

byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Washington, and Carl Hulse from Chicago.
byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and CARL HULSE

docs.lead_paragraph: A study found that among a sample of 24,000 Medicare beneficiaries, almost half of those who had had a normal colonoscopy underwent a repeat exam within seven years instead of waiting the recommended 10 years.

headline.seo: Colonoscopies Can Be Too Frequent, Study Says
headline.main: Screenings: When It’s Too Soon for a New Colonoscopy
headline.print_headline: SCREENINGS: When It’s Too Soon for a New Colonoscopy

docs.snippet: A study found that among a sample of 24,000 Medicare beneficiaries, almost half of those who had had a normal colonoscopy underwent a repeat exam within seven years instead of waiting the recommended 10 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sneaking into my mother's garage to disable the engine of her 1997 Honda Accord was not something I ever imagined doing in my role as daughter and caregiver of a parent in failing health. I was prepared to help with medical appointments, groceries, finances and social and personal needs, and in myriad other ways to walk alongside my mother as she coped with a deteriorating body and a mind weakened by dementia.

headline.kicker: POSTINGS | RECENT ENTRIES FROM OUR BLOGS

docs.abstract: Irene Wielawski The New Old Age blog describes manually disabling car in order to keep her mother, who suffers from dementia, from driving (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The bet was audacious from the beginning, and given the miserable, low-down tenor of contemporary politics, not unfathomable: Could you divide the country between greedy geezers and everyone else as a way to radically alter the social contract? But in order for the Republican plan to turn Medicare, one of most popular government programs in history, into a much-diminished voucher system, the greed card had to work.
docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column argues that the plan set forth by Rep Paul Ryan for reforming Medicare is a monumental miscalculation of public opinion on the issue (M)
docs.snippet: The bet was audacious from the beginning, and given the miserable, low-down tenor of contemporary politics, not unfathomable: Could you divide the country between greedy geezers and everyone else as a way to radically alter the social contract?    ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the House are back home in their districts this week, and in the case of some Republicans, protesters are along for the ride.

headline.main: Democrats Take Aim at G.O.P. Freshmen on Medicare

docs.abstract: The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee is taking aim at Republican members of Congress this week, with phone calls to constituents and protests at town hall meetings.
docs.snippet: The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee is taking aim at Republican members of Congress this week, with phone calls to constituents and protests at town hall meetings.
